results.title: Every drop to drink
results.creator_credit: Mary Francis, Ralph Bond, Metropolitan Water Board and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows how the Board meets the problem of supplying water to the huge population of London. Describes the supply sources from the Rivers Lea and Thames, and also from wells sunk in chalk subsoil; shows the purification plants and laboratories safeguarding the health of Londoners; describes the enormous reticulation and pumping system which serves an area of 54 square miles; shows also the installation of new pumping equipment and other plant to keep pace with the ever-growing demand for more water.

results.title: Every day, every night

results.title: Every day except Christmas
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Karel Reisz, Leon Clore, Ford Motor Company and Graphic Films
results.brief_description: The story of a day’s work at Covent Garden, from the moment when the first lorry arrives in the quiet and shuttered market soon after midnight, through the increasingly busy hours around dawn, until it subsides again into inertia as the last customers, the old flower ladies who sell in the streets at evening, make their modest purchases and depart. Lindsay Anderson’s documentary, a remarkable enterprising example of sponsorship on the part of the Ford Motor Company, has become widely known since it received the Grand Prix at Venice festival. It is a film of enormous technical skill: highly sophisticated poetic passages alternate with candid camera scenes close to life. Its real importance, however, is in its attitude - its intentness upon - the dignity of labour and workers and of the interdependence of our society, of which a market like Covent Garden is a highly significant symbol. Lindsay Anderson’s intention is summed up in the words which precede the title of the film: To Alice and George Bill. And Sid and Alan and George. And Derek and Bill and all the others… this film, about the market at Covent Garden, is affectionately dedicated. Script, Lindsay Anderson. Cinematography, Walter Lassally. Sound recording and editing, John Fletcher. Music, Daniel Paris. (Awards: Grand Prix Venice)

results.title: Every care but no responsibility
results.creator_credit: Bank of New South Wales and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: The methods used by different insects to try to ensure the survival of their offspring range from very complex behaviour patterns to taking no responsibility at all once the eggs are laid. This film shows some of this type of insect behaviour. Filmed and edited by Jim Frazier, music by Derek Straham.

results.title: Every baby a wanted baby
results.brief_description: A lecture on various methods of planning a family attended by couples with different backgrounds. The basic facts of human reproduction are also related with the use of animation.

results.title: Eventing
results.brief_description: Eventing is a test of all round horse riding skills in a partnership that comes alive galloping and jumping across country. This video shows the drama of the relationship of the top riders (Mark Todd, Virginia Leng, and Bruce Davidson), their preparations of their horse, Badminton, the months of training, the danger, the frustration and the World Championships. Magnificent slow motion sequences capture the Championships at Gawler, South Australia.

results.title: Eventful Britain [colour]
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Travel and Holidays Association
results.brief_description: Sets out to show that there is always something on in Britain. Ranges over a calendar of events, crowded with ceremonies and sporting fixtures which are open to all and cost little or nothing to attend. Includes such events as the Brighton Veteran Car Run, the Farnborough Air Show, the Henley Royal Regatta, the FA Cup Final at Wembley and much more.

results.title: Evaluation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James M. Smith and Davidson Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Specific learning disabilities”.
Follows two children with learning disabilities through a series of auditory, visual and motor tasks to determine their learning strengths and weaknesses. Interprets evaluation results and identifies optimal patterns for learning; relates parents perception of their children’s problems, presents relevant neurological and psychiatric information.
